meanings.definition: The process of converting a substance into vinegar.
meanings.sent1: During the acetification of apple cider, the liquid turns into vinegar over time.
meanings.sent2: The acetification of wine results in the tangy flavor of red wine vinegar.
meanings.sent3: The acetification of milk left in the fridge too long made for a sour surprise in my morning coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp tongue seemed to have undergone an acetification process, turning her words acidic and biting.
meanings.sent5: The acetification of the pickles in the jar was so strong, it made my eyes water just from the smell.

meanings.definition: The act of making something sour or acidic.
meanings.sent1: The acetification of the lemon juice gave it that puckering sour taste.
meanings.sent2: His constant complaints had an acetification effect on the mood of the room.
meanings.sent3: The acetification of the salad dressing was so intense, it made my lips pucker just from the smell.
meanings.sent4: The acetification of her attitude turned her from sweet to sour in a matter of minutes.
meanings.sent5: The acetification of the soil in the garden made it perfect for growing sour fruits like raspberries.
